Physiological/Pathological: Primarily pathological (cancer), can also do normal 3D cell aggregates
Cell Source: Any tumor cell line, primary cancer cells, co-culture with stromal fibroblasts
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (tumor + fibroblasts or immune cells in spheroid)
Tissue-resident Immune: Possible if included in the spheroid
Circulating Immune: N/A (W8 is an analyzer, no circulation in device)
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No multi-organ linking, single spheroid measurement
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, if spheroids produce ECM or partial embedding
3D Scaffold: Yes, if grown in hydrogel prior to W8 measurement
Notable Features: Label-free measurement of spheroid mass, size, density. Sorting viable spheroids post-analysis.
Plate/Format (Throughput): Low–medium throughput (tens of spheroids per run). Not a multi-well plate approach
Max Culture Duration: Spheroids are cultured externally; W8 is for short measurement
Readouts - Live Imaging: Basic imaging for size, not multi-channel fluorescence
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (spheroids can be recovered post measurement)
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (the entire organoid can be removed for histology)
Dead Volume: Minimal in microfluidics; short handling time
Real-time Microenvironment Control: No, only end-point or repeated measurements

Model: W8 Analysis of Patient-Derived Organoids (e.g., Glioblastoma, Prostate, etc.)
Organs/Tissues: Brain tumor organoids, prostate cancer organoids, or any patient-derived 3D tissue
Physiological/Pathological: Often pathological (tumor, disease organoids). Could measure healthy organoids too
Cell Source: Patient biopsy–derived organoids, co-culture with stroma
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (tumor cells + fibroblasts or other components)
Notable Features: Quantifies changes in organoid mass/density related to drug response, invasiveness
Plate/Format (Throughput): Low–medium throughput, single organoid scanning at a time
Max Culture Duration: Organoids cultured externally; W8 usage is short
Readouts - Live Imaging: Basic brightfield for morphological measurement, not multi-channel
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, organoids remain intact post measurement
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, can do endpoint histology after W8
Dead Volume: Low in the device’s microfluidic path

Organs/Tissues: Liver spheroids, cardiac microtissues, neural aggregates, etc.
Physiological/Pathological: Both – can measure healthy organoids or pathologic/fibrotic 3D structures
Cell Source: Any 3D culture (primary, iPSC-derived, etc.) in the 50–500 µm range
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, if produced by spheroid or used in scaffold
3D Scaffold: Yes, can measure scaffolded microtissues if free-floating
Notable Features: Label-free mass measurement, sorting spheroids for downstream assays
Max Culture Duration: Not cultured in W8; short analysis time
